docs.title: Nyarch Wiki
docs.text: The Nyarch Linux wiki is designed to be a straightforward and accessible resource for users of all skill levels, particularly those new to Nyarch Linux. Unlike the comprehensive Arch Wiki, the Nyarch Linux Wiki focuses on providing simpler, easy-to-understand information on various topics. Additionally, it offers Nyarch-specific guidance and recommendations to help you enhance your experience with Nyarch Linux.

docs.title: What goes in this wiki
docs.text:
• Simple tutorials and suggestions for beginners
  • Simplified explainations about Linux and Arch Linux (easier than the Arch Wiki, but also provide links to it)
  • Nyarch-specific usage suggestions

docs.title: What does not go in this wiki
docs.text:
• Server things
  • Advanced or dangerous topics
  • Detailed techincal explainations

docs.title: Contributing to the Wiki
docs.text:
You can contribute to the wiki on GitHub. To contribute to the wiki, log in into your github account and visit our repository.

The wiki is built using Mkdocs.

All the content files are in docs/. To create a new page, create a markdown file in that folder and add it to the index in the mkdocs.yml file.

You can choose if to clone the whole repo on your computer using git, or to edit the wiki directly from GitHub WebUI.

docs.title: Contributing to the Wiki from Github WebUI
docs.text:
First of all, fork the wiki using the button on the top part of the github page.

After the fork is created, you can edit the files directly from the Github WebUI by opening it and clicking on the pencil icon.

Here you can make changes and preview them.

After you have done the appropriate changes, click on commit changes and write a summary of what you have modified.

After that, click on "X commits ahead of..." to open a Pull Request

Create a pull request and explain all of your changes. We will review your changes, ask for appropriate modifications and accept them.

docs.title: Deploying the wiki
docs.text:
Firstly, clone the wiki:

git clone https://github.com/NyarchLinux/NyarchWiki

Install mkdocs and mkdocs-material in a python venv

python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material

Launch the wiki:

mkdocs serve

docs.title: Installing Applications
docs.text:
On Nyarch Linux you can install an application in multiple ways, that are called "Packaging Formats". This page explains the differences between the packages format and how to install and manage them.

Supported packages:

  1. Arch Linux Packages (pacman, .tar.zst)
  2. Flatpaks (Store, .flatpakref, .flatpak)
  3. AppImages (.appimage)
  4. Arch User Repository (yay, nyay)

docs.title: Arch Linux Packages
docs.text:
(Almost) Every Linux distribution has a package manager: it helps you to install, remove and update packages on your computer.

On Arch Linux, the package manager is pacman.

Because of multiple reasons, pacman is supposed to be only used via terminal and with admin privileges.

Here is some basic usage for pacman, if you want more detailed instructions, check pacman on the Arch Wiki

docs.title: How to install a package
docs.text:
sudo pacman -S package

For example, to install firefox, you can type

sudo pacman -S firefox

docs.title: How to remove a package
docs.text:
sudo pacman -R package

In case you also want to remove its dependencies, you can use -Rns.

docs.title: How to update every package
docs.text: sudo pacman -Syu

docs.title: How to search for a package
docs.text: sudo pacman -Ss package

docs.title: Flatpaks
docs.text:
Flatpak is a special packaging format that allows you to install applications in a sandboxed envirnomnet.

This means you can easily manage what permissions an application has, like you do on smartphones.

Flatpaks have some pros and cons: - Pros: - They work on every Linux distribution - You can control their permissions - Easy to install through the store - You can install applications without admin rights - Cons: - They take more disk space compared to native pacakges - They are sometimes problematic with some software that is not made to run inside a sandbox - Use for terminal programs often require doing some extra steps

docs.title: When should I install a flatpak?
docs.text:
• When the software is supposed to be primarly run as Flatpak (for example Bottles)
  • When you are installing a software that you don't trust (you can control its permissions)
  • Whent it's a GTK/Gnome application (because Nyarch ships their runtimes and they install fast)
  • When the software does not run in the terminal

docs.title: Gnome Software
docs.text: You can use Gnome Software to find, install, uninstall and update flatpak applications.

docs.title: From Flathub
docs.text:
You can find flatpaks on Flathub. Installing an application from there makes your browser download a .flatpakref file, clicking it opens the application on Gnome Software

Note: every application on flathub is also in Gnome Software

docs.title: Command Line
docs.text:
flatpak install application.id

For example, to install firefox via Flatpak

flatpak install org.mozilla.firefox

With command line, you can also install .flatpak files.

To do that, you can just run

flatpak install file.flatpak

Also, duble clicking on .flatpak file opens Gnome Software to install it.

docs.title: Managing Flatpak permissions
docs.text: You can manage flatpak permissions using Flatseal.

docs.title: Appimages
docs.text:
Appimages are a special format that can be run on every linux distribution. - Pros: - They work on every Linux distribution - Cons: - They do not share libraries with other applications - They are generally slower - Often they don't support theming

It is generally not suggested to use appimages if there are other packaging formats available. Use appimages only if there is no alternative.

docs.title: Installing and managing Appimages
docs.text:
After downloading an appimage, you can double click on it and it will launch GearLever.

GearLever is a simple software that helps you install and uninstall appimages. You can choose if run the appimage once without installing or add it to the app menu.

docs.title: Running appimages from command line
docs.text:
You can also straight up run an appimage from the command line by: 1. Giving it the permission to be executed

chmod +x application.appimage
  1. Running it
./application.appimage

docs.title: Arch User Repository
docs.text:
The AUR (Arch User Repository) is a big community-driven store for packages that aren't officially supported by Arch Linux. If an application exists, it's very likely that you will find it in the AUR.

Nyarch Linux is fully compatible with the AUR, since it uses defualt Arch Linux repositories.

Warning: The packages on the AUR are uploaded by users, so they might not be safe. It's suggested to always check if they are trustable from the packages builds.

docs.title: Installing a package
docs.text:
To install an AUR package, you need an AUR Helper.

By default, Nyarch Linux ships yay as default AUR helper. (Or nyay because lol nya)

To install an AUR package, you can run

yay -S package

For example, 

yay -S zen-browser-bin

docs.title: Updating packages
docs.text:
yay

Updates all the packages from the AUR

docs.title: Guide to Package names
docs.text:
You might encounter multiple packages for the same program. This is an example for Vesktop:

Based on the suffix:

  • -git: This package is built from the latest code in the Git repository. It might not be stable, but you'll get the latest features and updates. Also, it will compile the package

  • -bin: This package is a binary package, which means it's pre-compiled and ready to use. You don't need to build it from source

  • If there's no suffix, it usually means that the package is the "release" version. In other words, it's the latest stable version of the software, without any suffixes or prefixes.

docs.title: Install Nvidia Drivers
docs.text:
Starting from version 24.11.1, Nayrch Linux supports again a Nyarch version with nvidia proprietary drivers preinstalled.

However, if you have not installed the Nvidia version, or you have a not supported Nvidia GPU, you might have to install the drivers manually, and this guide is for you.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
You will need to have the multilib repository enabled. To do so, open /etc/pacman.conf with your favorite text editor and uncomment the following lines:

[multilib]
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

Then, update the repositories, and your system:

sudo pacman -Syu

Now, you can install the requirements:

sudo pacman -S base-devel linux-headers git nano --needed

For an average user with a modern gpu, simply install the nvidia package:

sudo pacman -S nvidia nvidia-utils

However, if you have an older GPU, please refer to the Arch Wiki guide.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
If you are a fellow old Windows user, you may know the Nvidia Control Panel. In Linux, we have nvidia-settings, which is a graphical tool to configure your Nvidia GPU.

To install it, simply run:

sudo pacman -S nvidia-settings

Then, you can run it from the terminal or from the application menu.

If you want to configure xorg with nvidia's automatic configuration, simply run the following command:

sudo nvidia-xconfig

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
If you have already installed a Linux Distribution, the installation procedure for Nyarch Linux is the same.

If you have not already installed a Linux Distribution, please consider installing another distribution. If you still want to go on, then you can decide to install Nyarch on:

  1. Your Computer
  2. Virtual Machine
  3. On an existing Linux Distro

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• A computer that respects the Resource Requirements
  • A USB Stick of at least 4GB capacity
  • Already a working computer (or android device if you use Etchdroid)
  • Downloaded the correct Nyarch ISO file. The ISO file can be found at https://nyarchlinux.moe/. If you have a Nvidia GPU, check the support here
  • A backup of every important file you have on your computer

docs.title: Creating a Bootable Drive
docs.text:
1. Download Balena Etcher or any similar program if you are more familiar with them
  2. Insert the USB Drive in your computer
  3. Open Balena Etcher

And click on "Flash from file". 4. Select Nyarch Linux ISO file you have downloaded before. 5. Click on select Target

And choose your USB Drive attention: be sure to choose the right drive since you will lose any file you have on it. 6. Click "Flash" and wait for it to finish.

docs.title: Choosing the installation method
docs.text: You can decide to install Nyarch in these ways: 1. Deleting the whole disk and install Nyarch 2. Install Nyarch alongside Windows in the same disk 3. Install Nyarch alongside Windows in another disk If you want to do 1 or 3, then skip to the next section. If you want to do 2, then you have to shrink your Windows partition.

docs.title: Shrinking Windows partition
docs.text:
1. Boot windows
  2. Cry
  3. Launch the Disk Management utility found under Create and format hard disk partitions.
  4. Right-click the primary Windows partition and select Shrink Volume...
  5. Shrink the size of the partition by at least 30GB. This will be the space left to Linux

docs.title: Booting the Live USB
docs.text:
1. Connect the USB drive to your device
  2. Access to the BIOS/UEFI Utility of your device. The procedure to access depends on your device. If you can't figure out how to access your BIOS, Spam F keys shouting Hora Hora Hora at the boot of your device till you get the right one.
  3. Disable Secure Boot
  4. Find the setting for the boot order and put your USB Drive in the first place. Alternatively, if you have access to the boot menu, launch it from there.
  5. Save and exit
  6. Hope that Nyarch Live boots. If it doesn't, check that you have actually set your USB at first place and then cry for help in Nyarch support channels (or any Linux community support).

docs.title: Nyarch Live Environment
docs.text:
You have hopefully succesfully booted Nyarch. Now you are in the Live Environment.

When you're installing a Linux distribution, a live environment is like a "try before you buy" experience. It's a temporary operating system that you can run from a USB drive or CD, without actually installing it on your computer's hard drive.

This way, you can test how the Linux distribution works, specially Wifi, hardware device, sound etc.... You can also explore some of Nyarch features, however consider that the performances are worst compared to the installed system due to USB drive I/O Speeds.

In case you need to do an operation that requires the user password to be put while you are in the live environment, the password is live.

docs.title: Nyarch Installer
docs.text:
The installer will be launched automatically at the start of the system.

It will then prompt you your localization settings. Compile them according to your preferences.

docs.title: Partitioning
docs.text:
Note: Be careful in this part since an error might cause data loss!

Here you can choose multiple things: - If to erase the entire disk and install Nyarch on it. You can choose a different disk in the upper part of the window.

  • If to replace a partition with Nyarch Install (not shown in the image)

  • If to install Nyarch alongside another OS (not shown in the image)

  • To manually choose your partitions (If you know what you are doing)

You can also choose:

  • Swap: it's like extra ram that is stored on your disk. It is strongly suggested to enable it.

  • Filesystem: You can choose you filesystem between these

  • ext4: is the standard for Linux distribution. It's faster in many cases and is considered to be more stable.

  • btrfs: supports instant snapshots, has more protection against data corruption and redundancy. a bit slower in some cases.

  • xfs: don't install it unless you know what you are doing

docs.title: Finishing the install
docs.text: Choose your name, and wait for the install to finish, and reboot!

docs.title: Install Nyarch on a Virtual Machine
docs.text:
• Suggested VM Softwares to install Nyarch: VMWare Workstation, QEMU, Gnome Boxes

  • Not suggested VM Softwares to install Nyarch: VirtualBox (because of the bad 3D acceleration)

Nyarch makes a lot of use of animations to enhance the user experience, so enable 3D acceleration in the VM. Otherwise it will lag as fuck. Bro you don't want to see worst animation than Blue Lock S2, trust me. Create a VM with these specifications:

  • CPU: As much as you can/prefer

  • Memory: at least 3GB, suggested 6GB for a fluid system

  • Storage: 30GB minimum for installing the OS

  • UEFI/BIOS are both supported

After you created and booted the VM, skip to Nyarch Live Environment

docs.title: Nyarch Assistant
docs.text: Nyarch Assistant is Nyarch Linux official AI Waifu Assistant.

docs.title: Nyarch Assistant and Newelle
docs.text:
Nyarch Assistant is a fork of Newelle.

Newelle is available on Flathub and is supposed to be an AI chatbot for Linux users in general, while Nyarch Assistant has some anime and Nyarch Linux-related things that do not make sense for normal users.

Newelle and Nyarch Linux will always be up to date with each other and Newelle extensions will always be compatible with Nyarch Assistant extensions.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Your dream waifu, at your command: Choose from a vast library of TTS voices and Live2D or LivePNG models to create the perfect virtual companion.

  • Terminal Command Execution: Execute terminal commands directly through the AI.

  • Advanced Customization: Tailor the application with a wide range of settings.

  • Flexible Model Support: Choose from multiple AI models to fit your specific needs.

  • Extensions support: Add custom LLM, TTS, STT, Avatars, prompts and additional functionalities with minimal python programming

  • Profile Support: Quickly switch totally different settings using our profile functionality

docs.title: Suggested LLM and models
docs.text:
You are totally free to choose what models and what providers to use Nyarch Assistant with. By default, Nyarch Assistant uses our Demo API (limited at 10req/day), that uses gemini-flash-2.0 for anything else. These API are just to showcase Nyarch Assistant, you are supposed to use another provider with API Key or use a local model with Ollama or our builtin loader.

If the provider you want is not supported, you can make your own extension or check the existing extensions.

  • For general purposes, general knowledge, coding and role playing, Llama3.1-70B+ models are suggested.
  • If you do more programming/IT things, qwen3-8b+, deepseek-r1, deepseek-v3, Mixtral8x22B, claude-3.5-sonnet models (of basically any size) are preferred.
  • For roleplay only, you might like qwen3-4b+, mythomax-l2-13b, llama3.1-7B, gemma3 models or wizardlm-2-8x22b.

For more information on how to setup different providers, read Newelle's user guide to LLMs

docs.title: Maximum Privacy
docs.text:
With these settings, everything will be run locally and no data about you will be sent anywhere.

Since these computations require a good amount of resources, a good GPU is suggested for good performances.

docs.title: Local LLMs
docs.text: Two offline models providers are supported: GPT4All (or "Local Model") and Ollama (Suggested). For instructions on how to setup them, read Newelle Wiki - Local Models. Using a model with Ollama is suggested as it has more fatures and generally better performances. For suggested models, read Suggested LLM and models

docs.title: TTS
docs.text: The best supported local TTS with natural sounding voices are Vits and VoiceVox. If you have a nice Nvidia GPU (RTX Series), TTS should be almost instant. In other cases, some loading time might be required.

docs.title: VoiceVox
docs.text:
VoiceVox is an open source TTS engine really natural sounding for Japanese.

Since it only supports Japanese, if you don't know Japanese, you can decide to enable translations.

docs.title: Installing and using VoiceVox
docs.text:
If you have Smart prompts enabled, you can ask Arch-chan to guide you through these steps! In case you don't trust here yapping, here are the full instructions.

Step 1: Install docker

sudo pacman -S docker
sudo systemctl enable --now docker

If you have a Nvidia GPU and you want to use it, also install nvidia-container-toolkit. Also, Nvidia proprietary drivers must be installed.

sudo pacman -S nvidia-container-toolkit
sudo systemctl restart docker.service

Step 2: Install the docker container

If you want to use CPU ONLY:

sudo docker pull voicevox/voicevox_engine:cpu-ubuntu20.04-latest

If you want to use Nvidia GPU:

sudo docker pull voicevox/voicevox_engine:nvidia-ubuntu20.04-latest

Step 3: Start the containter

If on cpu:

sudo docker run --rm -it -p '127.0.0.1:50021:50021' voicevox/voicevox_engine:cpu-ubuntu20.04-latest

If on gpu:

sudo docker run --rm --gpus all -p '127.0.0.1:50021:50021' voicevox/voicevox_engine:nvidia-ubuntu20.04-latest

You will have to start the container every time you want to use voicevox

Step 4: Configure it on Nyarch Assistant settings

Put http://localhost:50021 as endpoint (or the ip/port you chosen if you host it somewhere else). Then, close and reopen the settings to reload the voices and then choose your favourite voice.

docs.title: Nyarcher
docs.text: Nyarcher is a Shell script to install Nyarch Linux customizations on many Linux Distributions

docs.title: Disclaimer
docs.text: The script aims to give the most similar experience to Nyarch Linux on any Linux distribution, without editing system files. For these reasons, read the What you are missing section. Also, some applications, specially Nyarch Scripts, might not work correctly in non arch based distributions. The only opeartions that are going to edit system files, are flagged with [SYSTEM]. They are not dangerous, but you better know that they are doing it. If something goes wrong, by creating a new user on your distribution, you won't be affected by the changes that the script does, excluding the changes made by part of the script flagged as [SYSTEM].

docs.title: Install pre-requirements
docs.text: On any distribution, a working installation of Gnome 47 is needed

docs.title: Arch-based distributions
docs.text:
sudo pacman -S curl python-pip flatpak gnome-menus kitty wget git fastfetch npm nodejs pacman-contrib gnome-menus gnome-shell-extensions tar
sudo pacman -S python-pywal

It is also suggested to install webapp-manager and gnome-terminal-transparency from the AUR.

docs.title: Fedora based distributions
docs.text:
sudo dnf install curl flatpak python3-pip svn gnome-menus kitty wget git neofetch npm nodejs btop gnome-menus gnome-extensions-app
sudo pip3 install pywal
sudo cp /usr/local/bin/wal /usr/bin/wal

NOTE: wal needs to be in /usr/bin/wal, this is the reason of the last command

docs.title: Ubuntu based distributions
docs.text:
sudo apt install curl python3-pip flatpak subversion gnome-menus kitty wget git neofetch npm nodejs btop gnome-menus gnome-shell-extension-prefs
sudo pip3 install pywal

docs.title: Running the script
docs.text:
If you want to learn what the script does, you can read NYARCHER.md file. NOTE: The script back-ups most of the existing configuration before overwriting them, also, excluding /usr/bin/nyaofetch and /usr/bin/nekofetch files, it only edits settings for the current user Download nyarcher.sh and add the permission of execution, then execute it

git clone https://github.com/NyarchLinux/Nyarcher.git
cd Nyarcher
chmod +x nyarcher.sh
./nyarcher.sh

The script will ask you if you want to apply some settings, it is strongly suggested to say yes to everything in order to have a stable experience.

docs.title: What you are missing
docs.text:
By running this script, you are not going to have the full Nyarch experience, here are the things that are missing from the script, but are present in the distro.

Note that almost any of those things can be integrated in any distribution, by running some commands or editing a few files.

  • gnome-terminal-transparency is not installed by the script, it is a version of Gnome Terminal that implements transparency. Fedora users have it by default. You can install it from the AUR
  • Webapp manager is not installed by default, you can install it from the AUR
  • plymouth (boot animation) is not installed by this script, and neither its theme. Plymouth installation is very distro-specific, here is the wiki page for Arch Linux. The theme used by us is here
  • The breeze to install Nyarch on your bare metal hoping it won't destroy your pc
  • Calamares installation: Only available in the live ISO. It is an almost standard Calamares with adwaita qt theme, you can find here the slides that are shown during installation.
  • yay, installed by the script, they are AUR helpers, you can install it with another AUR helper. Yay is also aliased as nyay because lol
  • You will get some expected bugs that are not experienced on Nyarch:
  • Pywal theming is not going to be generated by default, to fix this, reload the theme (changing color theming from Nyarch Customize or just change the wallpaper if you have material you enabled)
  • You have to log out and log in again after running the script
  • Nyarch Tour won't start after you log back in, just run it yourself
  • Nyarch updater is very likely to not work correctly
  • Material You might not be able to apply Material You Gnome Shell theme automatically without logging in/out on some distros (encountered in Fedora). An easy fix has not been found yet. A workaraund without logging out is to change Gnome shell theme on gnome tweaks (or in extension settings) to another and turning back to Material You theme

docs.title: Nyarch Wiki
docs.text: Nyarch Linux Wiki 旨在为所有技能水平的用户提供简单明了且易于访问的资源，特别是对 Nyarch Linux 新手用户。 与全面的 Arch Wiki 不同，Nyarch Linux Wiki 专注于提供更简单、易于理解的各种主题信息。此外，它还提供 Nyarch 特定的指导和建议，帮助您提升 Nyarch Linux 的使用体验。

docs.title: 本 Wiki 包含的内容
docs.text:
• 面向初学者的简单教程和建议
  • 关于 Linux 和 Arch Linux 的简化说明（比 Arch Wiki 更简单，但也提供相关链接）
  • Nyarch 特定的使用建议

docs.title: 本 Wiki 不包含的内容
docs.text:
• 服务器相关内容
  • 高级或危险的主题
  • 详细的技术说明

docs.title: 为 Wiki 做贡献
docs.text:
您可以在 GitHub 上为 Wiki 做贡献。 要为 Wiki 做贡献，请登录您的 GitHub 账户并访问我们的仓库。

本 Wiki 使用 Mkdocs 构建。

所有内容文件都在 docs/ 目录中。要创建新页面，请在该文件夹中创建一个 markdown 文件，并将其添加到 mkdocs.yml 文件的索引中。

您可以选择使用 git 将整个仓库克隆到您的计算机上，或直接从 GitHub WebUI 编辑 Wiki。

docs.title: 从 Github WebUI 为 Wiki 做贡献
docs.text:
首先，使用 GitHub 页面顶部的按钮 fork 这个 Wiki。

Fork 创建后，您可以通过打开文件并点击铅笔图标直接从 Github WebUI 编辑文件。

在这里您可以进行更改并预览它们。

完成适当的更改后，点击 commit changes 并写下您修改内容的摘要。

之后，点击 "X commits ahead of..." 来打开一个 Pull Request

创建一个 Pull Request 并解释您的所有更改。我们将审查您的更改，要求适当的修改并接受它们。

docs.title: 部署 Wiki
docs.text:
首先，克隆 Wiki：

git clone https://github.com/NyarchLinux/NyarchWiki

在 Python 虚拟环境中安装 mkdocs 和 mkdocs-material

python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material mkdocs-static-i18n

启动 Wiki：

mkdocs serve

docs.title: 安装应用程序
docs.text:
在 Nyarch Linux 上，您可以通过多种方式安装应用程序，这些方式称为"打包格式"。 本页面解释了不同打包格式之间的差异以及如何安装和管理它们。

支持的软件包：

  1. Arch Linux 软件包 (pacman, .tar.zst)
  2. Flatpaks (商店, .flatpakref, .flatpak)
  3. AppImages (.appimage)
  4. Arch 用户仓库 (yay, nyay)

docs.title: Arch Linux 软件包
docs.text:
（几乎）每个 Linux 发行版都有一个包管理器：它帮助您在计算机上安装、删除和更新软件包。

在 Arch Linux 上，包管理器是 pacman。

由于多种原因，pacman 应该只通过终端并使用管理员权限使用。

以下是 pacman 的一些基本用法，如果您想要更详细的说明，请查看 Arch Wiki 上的 pacman

docs.title: 如何安装软件包
docs.text:
sudo pacman -S package

例如，要安装 firefox，您可以输入

sudo pacman -S firefox

docs.title: 如何删除软件包
docs.text:
sudo pacman -R package

如果您还想删除其依赖项，可以使用 -Rns。

docs.title: 如何更新所有软件包
docs.text: sudo pacman -Syu

docs.title: 如何搜索软件包
docs.text: sudo pacman -Ss package

docs.title: Flatpaks
docs.text:
Flatpak 是一种特殊的打包格式，允许您在沙盒环境中安装应用程序。

这意味着您可以轻松管理应用程序的权限，就像在智能手机上一样。

Flatpaks 有一些优缺点： - 优点： - 它们可以在每个 Linux 发行版上运行 - 您可以控制它们的权限 - 通过商店轻松安装 - 您可以在没有管理员权限的情况下安装应用程序 - 缺点： - 与原生软件包相比，它们占用更多磁盘空间 - 对于一些不适合在沙盒中运行的软件，它们有时会出现问题 - 终端程序的使用通常需要执行一些额外的步骤

docs.title: 我应该什么时候安装 flatpak？
docs.text:
• 当软件主要应该作为 Flatpak 运行时（例如 Bottles）
  • 当您安装不信任的软件时（您可以控制其权限）
  • 当它是 GTK/Gnome 应用程序时（因为 Nyarch 附带了它们的运行时，安装速度很快）
  • 当软件不在终端中运行时

docs.title: Gnome Software
docs.text: 您可以使用 Gnome Software 来查找、安装、卸载和更新 flatpak 应用程序。

docs.title: 从 Flathub
docs.text:
您可以在 Flathub 上找到 flatpaks。从那里安装应用程序会让您的浏览器下载一个 .flatpakref 文件，点击它会在 Gnome Software 中打开应用程序

注意：flathub 上的每个应用程序也都在 Gnome Software 中

docs.title: 命令行
docs.text:
flatpak install application.id

例如，通过 Flatpak 安装 firefox

flatpak install org.mozilla.firefox

使用命令行，您还可以安装 .flatpak 文件。

要做到这一点，您只需运行

flatpak install file.flatpak

此外，双击 .flatpak 文件会打开 Gnome Software 来安装它。

docs.title: 管理 Flatpak 权限
docs.text: 您可以使用 Flatseal 管理 flatpak 权限。

docs.title: Appimages
docs.text:
Appimages 是一种可以在每个 Linux 发行版上运行的特殊格式。 - 优点： - 它们可以在每个 Linux 发行版上运行 - 缺点： - 它们不与其他应用程序共享库 - 它们通常较慢 - 通常它们不支持主题

如果有其他打包格式可用，通常不建议使用 appimages。 仅在没有替代方案时使用 appimages。

docs.title: 安装和管理 Appimages
docs.text:
下载 appimage 后，您可以双击它，它将启动 GearLever。

GearLever 是一个简单的软件，可帮助您安装和卸载 appimages。 您可以选择运行一次 appimage 而不安装，或将其添加到应用程序菜单。

docs.title: 从命令行运行 appimages
docs.text:
您也可以直接从命令行运行 appimage： 1. 给它执行权限

chmod +x application.appimage
  1. 运行它
./application.appimage

docs.title: Arch 用户仓库
docs.text:
AUR（Arch 用户仓库）是一个由社区驱动的大型软件包商店，用于 Arch Linux 官方不支持的软件包。如果一个应用程序存在，您很可能会在 AUR 中找到它。

Nyarch Linux 完全兼容 AUR，因为它使用默认的 Arch Linux 仓库。

警告：AUR 上的软件包由用户上传，因此它们可能不安全。建议始终从软件包构建中检查它们是否可信。

docs.title: 安装软件包
docs.text:
要安装 AUR 软件包，您需要一个 AUR Helper。

默认情况下，Nyarch Linux 附带 yay 作为默认的 AUR helper。（或者 nyay，因为 lol nya）

要安装 AUR 软件包，您可以运行

yay -S package

例如，

yay -S zen-browser-bin

docs.title: 更新软件包
docs.text:
yay

更新 AUR 中的所有软件包

docs.title: 软件包名称指南
docs.text:
您可能会遇到同一程序的多个软件包。这是 Vesktop 的一个例子：

基于后缀：

  • -git：此软件包是从 Git 仓库中的最新代码构建的。它可能不稳定，但您将获得最新的功能和更新。此外，它将编译软件包

  • -bin：此软件包是二进制软件包，这意味着它是预编译的并且可以直接使用。您不需要从源代码构建它

  • 如果没有后缀，通常意味着该软件包是"发布"版本。换句话说，它是软件的最新稳定版本，没有任何后缀或前缀。

docs.title: 安装 Nvidia 驱动
docs.text:
从 24.11.1 版本开始，Nyarch Linux 再次支持预装 Nvidia 专有驱动的 Nyarch 版本。

但是，如果您没有安装 Nvidia 版本，或者您的 Nvidia GPU 不受支持，您可能需要手动安装驱动程序，本指南适合您。

docs.title: 安装
docs.text:
您需要启用 multilib 仓库。为此，请使用您喜欢的文本编辑器打开 /etc/pacman.conf 并取消注释以下行：

[multilib]
Include = /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist

然后，更新仓库和您的系统：

sudo pacman -Syu

现在，您可以安装所需的软件包：

sudo pacman -S base-devel linux-headers git nano --needed

对于拥有现代 GPU 的普通用户，只需安装 nvidia 软件包：

sudo pacman -S nvidia nvidia-utils

但是，如果您有较旧的 GPU，请参考 Arch Wiki 指南。

docs.title: 配置
docs.text:
如果您是老 Windows 用户，您可能知道 Nvidia 控制面板。在 Linux 中，我们有 nvidia-settings，这是一个用于配置 Nvidia GPU 的图形工具。

要安装它，只需运行：

sudo pacman -S nvidia-settings

然后，您可以从终端或应用程序菜单运行它。

如果您想使用 Nvidia 的自动配置来配置 xorg，只需运行以下命令：

sudo nvidia-xconfig

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
如果您已经安装了 Linux 发行版，Nyarch Linux 的安装过程是相同的。

如果您还没有安装过 Linux 发行版，请考虑安装另一个发行版。 如果您仍然想继续，那么您可以决定在以下位置安装 Nyarch：

  1. 您的计算机
  2. 虚拟机
  3. 在现有的 Linux 发行版上

docs.title: 在您的计算机上安装 Nyarch
前置条件
docs.text:
• 一台符合资源要求的计算机
  • 至少 4GB 容量的 USB 闪存盘
  • 已经有一台可以工作的计算机（或者如果您使用 Etchdroid，则可以使用 Android 设备）
  • 下载了正确的 Nyarch ISO 文件。ISO 文件可以在 https://nyarchlinux.moe/ 找到。如果您有 Nvidia GPU，请在这里检查支持
  • 备份您计算机上的每个重要文件

docs.title: 创建可启动驱动器
docs.text:
1. 下载 Balena Etcher 或任何类似的程序（如果您更熟悉它们）
  2. 将 USB 驱动器插入您的计算机
  3. 打开 Balena Etcher

然后点击"Flash from file"。 4. 选择您之前下载的 Nyarch Linux ISO 文件。 5. 点击 select Target

然后选择您的 USB 驱动器 注意：确保选择正确的驱动器，因为您将丢失其上的任何文件。 6. 点击"Flash"并等待完成。

docs.title: 选择安装方法
docs.text: 您可以决定以以下方式安装 Nyarch： 1. 删除整个磁盘并安装 Nyarch 2. 在同一磁盘上与 Windows 一起安装 Nyarch 3. 在另一个磁盘上与 Windows 一起安装 Nyarch 如果您想执行 1 或 3，则跳到下一部分。 如果您想执行 2，则必须缩小您的 Windows 分区。

docs.title: 缩小 Windows 分区
docs.text:
1. 启动 Windows
  2. 哭泣
  3. 启动在"创建和格式化硬盘分区"下找到的 磁盘管理 实用程序。
  4. 右键单击主 Windows 分区并选择"压缩卷..."
  5. 将分区大小缩小至少 30GB。这将是留给 Linux 的空间

docs.title: 启动 Live USB
docs.text:
1. 将 USB 驱动器连接到您的设备
  2. 访问您设备的 BIOS/UEFI 实用程序。访问的过程取决于您的设备。 如果您无法弄清楚如何访问 BIOS，请在设备启动时疯狂按 F 键，同时喊 Hora Hora Hora，直到找到正确的键。
  3. 禁用安全启动
  4. 找到启动顺序的设置，并将您的 USB 驱动器放在第一位。或者，如果您可以访问启动菜单，请从那里启动它。
  5. 保存并退出
  6. 希望 Nyarch Live 能够启动。如果没有，请检查您是否确实将 USB 设置在第一位，然后在 Nyarch 支持频道（或任何 Linux 社区支持）中寻求帮助。

docs.title: Nyarch Live 环境
docs.text:
您希望已成功启动 Nyarch。 现在您处于 Live 环境中。

当您安装 Linux 发行版时，live 环境就像"先试后买"的体验。 它是一个临时操作系统，您可以从 USB 驱动器或 CD 运行，而无需实际将其安装在计算机的硬盘驱动器上。

这样，您可以测试 Linux 发行版的工作方式，特别是 Wifi、硬件设备、声音等...。您还可以探索 Nyarch 的一些功能，但请考虑与已安装的系统相比，性能较差，这是由于 USB 驱动器的 I/O 速度。

如果您在 live 环境中需要执行需要输入用户密码的操作，密码是 live。

docs.title: Nyarch 安装程序
docs.text:
安装程序将在系统启动时自动启动。

然后它会提示您输入本地化设置。根据您的偏好填写它们。

docs.title: 分区
docs.text:
注意：在这部分要小心，因为错误可能会导致数据丢失！

在这里您可以选择多种内容： - 是否擦除整个磁盘并在其上安装 Nyarch。您可以在窗口的上部选择不同的磁盘。

  • 是否用 Nyarch 安装替换分区（图像中未显示）

  • 是否与另一个操作系统一起安装 Nyarch（图像中未显示）

  • 手动选择您的分区（如果您知道自己在做什么）

您还可以选择：

  • Swap：它就像存储在磁盘上的额外 RAM。强烈建议启用它。

  • 文件系统：您可以在以下文件系统之间进行选择

  • ext4：是 Linux 发行版的标准。在许多情况下它更快，并且被认为更稳定。

  • btrfs：支持即时快照，对数据损坏和冗余有更多保护。在某些情况下稍慢。

  • xfs：除非您知道自己在做什么，否则不要安装它

docs.title: 完成安装
docs.text: 选择您的名称，等待安装完成，然后重新启动！

docs.title: 在虚拟机上安装 Nyarch
docs.text:
• 建议用于安装 Nyarch 的 VM 软件：VMWare Workstation、QEMU、Gnome Boxes

  • 不建议用于安装 Nyarch 的 VM 软件：VirtualBox（因为 3D 加速不好）

Nyarch 大量使用动画来增强用户体验，因此在 VM 中启用 3D 加速。否则它会卡得要命。兄弟，你不想看到比 Blue Lock S2 更糟糕的动画，相信我。 创建具有以下规格的 VM：

  • CPU：尽可能多/根据您的喜好

  • 内存：至少 3GB，建议 6GB 以获得流畅的系统

  • 存储：安装操作系统至少需要 30GB

  • 支持 UEFI/BIOS

创建并启动 VM 后，跳到 Nyarch Live 环境

docs.title: Nvidia 支持
docs.text:
从 24.11.1 版本开始，Nyarch Linux 再次支持预装 Nvidia 专有驱动的 Nyarch 版本。

注意： Nvidia 版本不支持 RTX5000 GPU。您需要在普通 ISO 上手动安装 nvidia-open 驱动。

它还将安装 envycontrol 来管理混合显卡，在 Gnome 中可以简单切换。

注意： 如果您在虚拟机上安装 Nyarch，请使用普通的 Nyarch ISO。

docs.title: 支持的 GPU
docs.text:
Nvidia ISO 支持所有仍受 nvidia 驱动支持的 GPU，即 NV110+ 到 (NV190/ADXXX)（基本上是 GeForce 750+ GPU 直到 RTX 5000（不包括），您可以在这里查看列表）。

如果您的 Nvidia GPU 不受支持，您可能需要手动安装驱动程序。

docs.title: 手动安装驱动
docs.text: 只需按照这个指南操作。

docs.title: Nyarch Assistant
docs.text: Nyarch Assistant 是 Nyarch Linux 官方的 AI 老婆助手。

docs.title: Nyarch Assistant 和 Newelle
docs.text:
Nyarch Assistant 是 Newelle 的一个分支。

Newelle 可在 Flathub 上获得，旨在成为一般 Linux 用户的 AI 聊天机器人，而 Nyarch Assistant 有一些动漫和 Nyarch Linux 相关的内容，对普通用户来说没有意义。

Newelle 和 Nyarch Linux 将始终保持彼此同步，Newelle 扩展将始终与 Nyarch Assistant 扩展兼容。

docs.title: 功能
docs.text:
• 您梦想中的老婆，听您指挥：从庞大的 TTS 语音和 Live2D 或 LivePNG 模型库中选择，创建完美的虚拟伴侣。

  • 终端命令执行：直接通过 AI 执行终端命令。

  • 高级自定义：通过广泛的设置定制应用程序。

  • 灵活的模型支持：选择多个 AI 模型以满足您的特定需求。

  • 扩展支持：通过最少的 Python 编程添加自定义 LLM、TTS、STT、头像、提示和其他功能

  • 配置文件支持：使用我们的配置文件功能快速切换完全不同的设置

docs.title: 推荐的 LLM 和模型
docs.text:
您完全可以自由选择使用哪些模型和提供商来使用 Nyarch Assistant。 默认情况下，Nyarch Assistant 使用我们的演示 API（限制为 10 次请求/天），该 API 对其他所有内容使用 gemini-flash-2.0。这些 API 只是为了展示 Nyarch Assistant，您应该使用带有 API 密钥的另一个提供商或使用 Ollama 或我们的内置加载器使用本地模型。

如果不支持您想要的提供商，您可以制作自己的扩展或查看现有扩展。

  • 对于一般用途、常识、编码和角色扮演，建议使用 Llama3.1-70B+ 模型。
  • 如果您做更多编程/IT 相关的事情，建议使用 qwen3-8b+、deepseek-r1、deepseek-v3、Mixtral8x22B、claude-3.5-sonnet 模型（基本上任何大小）。
  • 仅用于角色扮演，您可能喜欢 qwen3-4b+、mythomax-l2-13b、llama3.1-7B、gemma3 模型或 wizardlm-2-8x22b。

有关如何设置不同提供商的更多信息，请阅读 Newelle 的 LLM 用户指南

docs.title: 最大隐私
docs.text:
使用这些设置，所有内容都将在本地运行，不会向任何地方发送有关您的数据。

由于这些计算需要大量资源，建议使用良好的 GPU 以获得良好的性能。

docs.title: 本地 LLM
docs.text: 支持两个离线模型提供商：GPT4All（或"本地模型"）和 Ollama（推荐）。有关如何设置它们的说明，请阅读 Newelle Wiki - 本地模型。 建议使用 Ollama 的模型，因为它具有更多功能和通常更好的性能。 有关推荐的模型，请阅读推荐的 LLM 和模型

docs.title: TTS
docs.text: 最好支持的具有自然声音的本地 TTS 是 Vits 和 VoiceVox。如果您有不错的 Nvidia GPU（RTX 系列），TTS 应该几乎是即时的。在其他情况下，可能需要一些加载时间。

docs.title: VoiceVox
docs.text:
VoiceVox 是一个开源 TTS 引擎，日语听起来非常自然。

由于它只支持日语，如果您不懂日语，您可以决定启用翻译。

docs.title: 安装和使用 VoiceVox
docs.text:
如果您启用了智能提示，您可以要求 Arch-chan 指导您完成这些步骤！如果您不相信她的话，这里是完整的说明。

步骤 1：安装 docker

sudo pacman -S docker
sudo systemctl enable --now docker

如果您有 Nvidia GPU 并且想要使用它，还要安装 nvidia-container-toolkit。此外，必须安装 Nvidia 专有驱动程序。

sudo pacman -S nvidia-container-toolkit
sudo systemctl restart docker.service

步骤 2：安装 docker 容器

如果您想使用 仅 CPU：

sudo docker pull voicevox/voicevox_engine:cpu-ubuntu20.04-latest

如果您想使用 Nvidia GPU：

sudo docker pull voicevox/voicevox_engine:nvidia-ubuntu20.04-latest

步骤 3：启动容器

如果在 cpu 上：

sudo docker run --rm -it -p '127.0.0.1:50021:50021' voicevox/voicevox_engine:cpu-ubuntu20.04-latest

如果在 gpu 上：

sudo docker run --rm --gpus all -p '127.0.0.1:50021:50021' voicevox/voicevox_engine:nvidia-ubuntu20.04-latest

每次您想使用 voicevox 时都必须启动容器

步骤 4：在 Nyarch Assistant 设置中配置它

将 http://localhost:50021 作为端点（或者如果您在其他地方托管它，则使用您选择的 ip/端口）。 然后，关闭并重新打开设置以重新加载语音，然后选择您最喜欢的语音。

docs.title: 语音克隆
docs.text: 您可以使用此扩展使用 TTS 进行语音克隆。

docs.title: Nyarcher
docs.text: Nyarcher 是一个 Shell 脚本，用于在许多 Linux 发行版上安装 Nyarch Linux 自定义设置

docs.title: 免责声明
docs.text: 该脚本旨在在任何 Linux 发行版上提供与 Nyarch Linux 最相似的体验，而不编辑系统文件。因此，请阅读您缺少的内容部分。 此外，某些应用程序，特别是 Nyarch Scripts，可能无法在非 Arch 基础发行版上正常工作。 唯一会编辑系统文件的操作标记为 [SYSTEM]。它们并不危险，但您最好知道它们正在这样做。 如果出现问题，通过在您的发行版上创建一个新用户，您将不会受到脚本所做更改的影响，不包括脚本中标记为 [SYSTEM] 的部分所做的更改。

docs.title: 安装前置要求
docs.text: 在任何发行版上，都需要正常工作的 Gnome 47 安装

docs.title: 基于 Arch 的发行版
docs.text:
sudo pacman -S curl python-pip flatpak gnome-menus kitty wget git fastfetch npm nodejs pacman-contrib gnome-menus gnome-shell-extensions tar
sudo pacman -S python-pywal

还建议从 AUR 安装 webapp-manager 和 gnome-terminal-transparency。

docs.title: 基于 Fedora 的发行版
docs.text:
sudo dnf install curl flatpak python3-pip svn gnome-menus kitty wget git neofetch npm nodejs btop gnome-menus gnome-extensions-app
sudo pip3 install pywal
sudo cp /usr/local/bin/wal /usr/bin/wal

注意：wal 需要在 /usr/bin/wal 中，这是最后一个命令的原因

docs.title: 基于 Ubuntu 的发行版
docs.text:
sudo apt install curl python3-pip flatpak subversion gnome-menus kitty wget git neofetch npm nodejs btop gnome-menus gnome-shell-extension-prefs
sudo pip3 install pywal

docs.title: 运行脚本
docs.text:
如果您想了解脚本的作用，可以阅读 NYARCHER.md 文件。 注意：脚本在覆盖之前会备份大部分现有配置，此外，除了 /usr/bin/nyaofetch 和 /usr/bin/nekofetch 文件外，它只编辑当前用户的设置 下载 nyarcher.sh 并添加执行权限，然后执行它

git clone https://github.com/NyarchLinux/Nyarcher.git
cd Nyarcher
chmod +x nyarcher.sh
./nyarcher.sh

脚本会询问您是否要应用某些设置，强烈建议对所有内容都说是，以获得稳定的体验。

docs.title: 您缺少的内容
docs.text:
通过运行此脚本，您将无法获得完整的 Nyarch 体验，以下是脚本中缺少但在发行版中存在的内容。

请注意，几乎所有这些内容都可以通过运行一些命令或编辑几个文件集成到任何发行版中。

  • gnome-terminal-transparency 不是由脚本安装的，它是实现透明度的 Gnome Terminal 版本。Fedora 用户默认拥有它。您可以从 AUR 安装它
  • Webapp manager 默认情况下未安装，您可以从 AUR 安装它
  • plymouth（启动动画）不是由此脚本安装的，其主题也不是。Plymouth 安装非常特定于发行版，这是 Arch Linux 的 wiki 页面。我们使用的主题在这里
  • 在您的裸机上安装 Nyarch 的微风，希望它不会破坏您的电脑
  • Calamares 安装：仅在 live ISO 中可用。它是一个几乎标准的 Calamares，带有 adwaita qt 主题，您可以在这里找到安装期间显示的幻灯片
  • yay，由脚本安装，它们是 AUR helpers，您可以使用另一个 AUR helper 安装它。Yay 也被别名为 nyay，因为 lol
  • 您会遇到一些在 Nyarch 上不会遇到的预期错误：
  • Pywal 主题默认情况下不会生成，要解决此问题，请重新加载主题（从 Nyarch Customize 更改颜色主题，或者如果您启用了 material you，只需更改壁纸）
  • 运行脚本后，您必须注销并重新登录
  • 重新登录后，Nyarch Tour 不会启动，只需自己运行它
  • Nyarch updater 很可能无法正常工作
  • Material You 可能无法在某些发行版上自动应用 Material You Gnome Shell 主题而不登录/注销（在 Fedora 中遇到）。尚未找到简单的修复方法。不注销的解决方法是在 gnome tweaks（或在扩展设置中）将 Gnome shell 主题更改为另一个，然后再切换回 Material You 主题
